author: IGN
description:
Hey everyone! In today’s Daily Fix: Stellar Blade is now Sony’s biggest single-player launch on Steam, beating Ghost of Tsushima with over 105K players! Plus, Konami just announced a Silent Hill 1 remake from the Silent Hill 2 devs, Bloober Team. 
Presented by MindsEye
title: Stellar Blade Is One of Sony's Biggest Steam Launches Ever - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
IGN and Tech Tesseract partnered with Intel at IGN Live 2025 to build two custom Intel powered PCs during the event! Each build highlights different setups tailored for gaming and productivity-focused users. Whether you're a PC building enthusiast, or just a fan of Tech Tesseract, you won't want to miss it!

Presented by Intel Gaming

#IGN #Gaming
title: We Built 2 Very Different PCs in 1 Day — Live With Tech Tesseract! - IGN LIVE 2025

author: IGN
description:
Reviewer Tom Marks takes a look at the Nintendo Switch 2 port of Cyberpunk 2077 after playing its early missions.

This footage was captured while docked in Quality mode, which runs at 1080p and 30 FPS, while Performance mode runs at 1080p and 40 FPS. Played handheld, it runs at 720p and 40 FPS or 1080p and 30 FPS, respectively.

#IGN #Gaming #NintendoSwitch2
title: Cyberpunk 2077 Nintendo Switch 2 Review Update

author: IGN
description:
Check out 16 minutes of tense early gameplay footage from System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster in this video for the upcoming modernization of the classic 1999 game. System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster features remastered visuals; a fully revamped co-op multiplayer mode; settings for an adjustable FOV, post-processing effects, and ultra-widescreen support; and more. System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster will be available for Windows PC via Steam, GOG, and the Humble Bundle Store, and for PlayStation 4 (PS4), PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Nintendo Switch on June 26, 2025.

Set 42 years after the events of the first System Shock, antagonist SHODAN and her army of merciless mutants return to infest the starship Von Braun. Players embody a soldier who awakens from cryo-sleep with cybernetic implants grafted to his flesh. As he sets out to unravel the horrifying mystery of the derelict starship, he’ll need to hone his upgradable skills and utilize power
title: System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster - Official 16 Minutes of Gameplay

author: IGN
description: Take a look at the Developer Game Overview Video for the first-person story-driven game Atomic Heart 2 developed by Mundfish, the MMO RPG shooter The Cube developed by Mundfish, and the upcoming horror survival game ILL developed by Team Clout. Players can hear straight from the founder of Mundfish, Robert Bagratuni, on the direction these games are going, extended looks at gameplay, and more information as the development teams head towards launch. Atomic Heart 2, The Cube, and ILL are coming soon to consoles and PC.
title: Atomic Heart 2, The Cube, and ILL - Official Developer Game Overviews

author: IGN
description: Character skins and a new Nightmare level arrive in Sonic Dream Team today (June 12, 2025). Watch the latest Sonic Dream Team trailer for the action-platformer game to see what you can expect. Suit up and blast into the Dream in style!
title: Sonic Dream Team - Official New Costume Update Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Join the developers for a deep dive into the gameplay of Darwin's Paradox in this new video from the upcoming platformer and adventure game. Dive into the adventure with Darwin, an octopus as endearing as he is ingenious, torn from the ocean and trapped in a vast and mysterious industrial complex. Harness his unique talents and abilities to help him overcome the many dangers and traps. Darwin's Paradox will be available on PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X/S, Nintendo Switch, and Steam.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Darwin's Paradox - Official Developer Overview Trailer | Konami Press Start Showcase

author: IGN
description: Watch the Extended Arbites Gameplay for Warhammer 40,000: Darktide, a team-based combat first-person shooter developed by Fatshark. Players can get a look at over 7 minutes of gameplay of Arbitrators, an upcoming class being added to Warhammer 40,000: Darktide. The Arbitrators are accompanied by their cybernetically-enhanced companions in their element, dispensing the Emperor’s justice with ruthless efficiency. The Arbites Class is launching on June 23 to Warhammer 40,000: Darktide for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam).
title: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide - Official Extended Arbites Gameplay

author: IGN
description: "The Schwartz Awakens in 2027." Check out the Spaceballs 2 announcement teaser for this upcoming sequel to the iconic sci-fi comedy adventure film.
title: Spaceballs 2 - Official Announcement Teaser (2027) Mel Brooks

author: IGN
description:
Check out the Gameplay Trailer for Marvel Mystic Mayhem, a free-to-play mobile tactical RPG developed by NetEase Games. Players will make use of Marvel's biggest heroes to duke it out and save the world at all costs. Work as a team to apply Attacks to enemies, Buffs and Shields to allies, and more, requiring strategic turn-based gameplay to secure the win. Marvel Mystic Mayhem is launching on June 25 for iOS and Android.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Marvel Mystic Mayhem - Official Gameplay Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Take another look at Heading Out in this action-packed trailer for the narrative-focused driving adventure game inspired by classic American road movies. Heading Out is coming to Xbox Series X/S and PlayStation 5 (PS5). It is out now on PC (Steam), and an update is available today (June 12, 2025), bringing interface improvements, increased game stability, performance boost, and numerous bug fixes. 

Set in a mythologized version of the United States, step into the shoes of a mysterious fugitive on the run—part outlaw, part folk hero—racing against fear itself across a stylized, black-and-white landscape in Heading Out.
title: Heading Out - Official Console Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description: Renown’s crunchy combat has a lot of potential in a genre not known for making close combat an elaborate affair. Meanwhile, the basic and sometimes mundane gathering and building game that you have to trudge through to get to cool stuff is very raw and still has a ways to go to meet the quality standard of the games it hopes to compete with. Previewed by Jarrett Green
title: Renown Has Medieval Survival Promise but Has a Lot of Work Left to Do

author: IGN
description:
Meet the characters and learn more about the story of Suikoden: Star Leap in this new trailer for the upcoming RPG from Konami in the Suikoden series coming to iOS, Android, and Steam. Set in the same world as previous Suikoden games, Star Leap focuses on a new 108 stars.

Suikoden Star Leap takes place four years before the events of Suikoden I in Solar Year 453, but a couple years after Suikoden V. Players can explore vibrant, bustling towns and meet new and familiar characters along their quests.

#SuikodenStarLeap #Gaming #IGN
title: Suikoden: Star Leap - Official Story Trailer | Konami Press Start Showcase

author: IGN
description:
Watch the The Sims 4: Enchanted by Nature trailer for this upcoming expansion pack for the sim game. In The Sims 4: Enchanted by Nature, live surrounded by nature and embrace a free-spirited lifestyle. Who needs beds and plumbing? It's time to get comfy in the great outdoors by meeting your Sims' needs in nature and foraging for food and collectables. 

There's a charming world to explore, and it has a mystical side. Experience strange Ailments, craft Elixirs, and even become a Fairy! When creating Fairy Sims, you'll choose from a variety of beautiful wings that you can paint freely.

The Sims 4: Enchanted by Nature will be available on EA App PC/Mac, Steam, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4 (PS4), and PlayStation 5 (PS5) at 10 am PT.

#TheSims4 #EnchantedByNature #Gaming
title: The Sims 4: Enchanted by Nature - Official Reveal Trailer

author: IGN
description:
It’s been more than 25 years since the original Silent Hill debuted, successfully blending J-horror and psychological horror into the survival horror genre on the PlayStation One. In the time since, Silent Hill has taken its place among the Mount Rushmore of survival horror franchises, but as the entries progressed its J-horror roots have shriveled. Silent Hill f is looking to change all that and IGN’s Nick Limon, Matt Kim, and John Davison talk about what this Japanaese-based Silent Hill means for the future of the franchise.

Presented by MindsEye. Available Now.
title: Silent Hill f is leaning more into it's J-Horror Roots

author: IGN
description:
Watch the Vibrant Visuals and Chase the Skies Release Date Trailer for Minecraft, the hit exploration creation game developed by Mojang. Players will soon be able to access both updates with Vibrant Visuals and Chase the Skies for Minecraft. Vibrant Visuals will offer players graphic improvements as water reflects, fog drifts, and waterfalls glimmer alongside the Chase the Skies update, bringing flying mounts, happy ghasts, and more for players to enjoy. Both Vibrant Visuals and Chse the Skies Updates are alaunching on June 17 for Minecraft.

#Minecraft #Gaming #IGN
title: Minecraft - Official Vibrant Visuals and Chase the Skies Release Date Trailer

author: IGN
description:
A dormant Konami has stirred from its slumber thanks to the success of the Bloober Silent Hill 2 Remake. After dropping its Press Start Showcase, we got another look at Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater's bonus features and Fox Hunt online multiplayer mode, Darwin's Paradox, Suikoden 2 for Nintendo Switch 2, Silent Hill f, and the surprise reveal of a Bloober Team Silent Hill 1 Remake we need to ask -- did this deliver on the hype?

Presented by Nintendo Switch 2. All Together, Anytime, Anywhere.

#ign #summerofgaming
title: Did the Konami Press Start Showcase Deliver?

author: IGN
description:
Konami gave fans another look at Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater during their Summer Press Start livestream that featured a look at Snake Eater's bosses often described as the series' best bosses, the return of Snake vs. Monkey, the addition of Snake vs. Bomberman, and a look at Metal Gear Solid Delta's Online mode called Foxhunt that was described as something different to Metal Gear Online (MGO). IGN's Nick Limon, Matt Kim, and John Davison discuss the reveal of Metal Gear Solid Delta's online multiplayer and more.

Presented by Lenovo Legion. Reach Your Impossible.

#mgs #ign
title: Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater - Can Fox Hunt Live Up to the Legacy of MGO?

author: IGN
description:
Konami has rounded off Summer Of Gaming with their very own Konami Press Start 2025 event! And we've put together a highlight reel of everything they've shown, including:

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater (which features Snake VS Monkey for PlayStation 5 and Steam, Snake VS Bomberman on Xbox Series X|S, Metal Gear Online Fox Hunt and more), Darwin's Paradox, eFootball featuring Messi, Suarez, and Neymar Jr, eBaseball: MLB PRO SPIRIT, Yu-Gi-Oh! Card Game: The Chronicles, Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars, Suikoden Star Leap, Gradius Origins, Deliver At All Costs, Edens Zero, Survival Kids, Silent Hill f and the upcoming Silent Hill 1 Remake from Bloober Team.

#IGN #Konami #MetalGearSolid #MGS #SilentHill #SilentHillRemake
title: Konami Press Start 2025: Everything Announced

author: IGN
description:
IGN’s Nick Limon, Matt Kim, and John Davison talk about one of the bigger reveals of the Konami Press Start, Silent Hill Remake. It’s been over a quarter of a century since the original Silent Hill dropped on the original PlayStation. Now, Konami has teamed up with Bloober—the same devs behind 2024’s Silent Hill 2 Remake—to remake Keiichiro Toyama’s survival horror classic. Despite some stumbles with games like The Medium, the IGN team discusses why Bloober is the perfect dev team to bing another Silent Hill game to modern audiences.

IGN's Summer of Gaming is presented by: 
FX’s Alien: Earth. Premieres August 12th on FX and Hulu.
title: Silent Hill Remake: Can Bloober Deliver again?

author: IGN
description:
Check out this announcement tease for the Silent Hill remake of the 1999 survival horror game, currently in development from Konami and Bloober Team.

#SilentHillRemake #SilentHill #Gaming

description:
Take a look at the PC Launch Trailer for Stellar Blade, a third-person action melee-based game developed by Shift Up. Players will fight as Eve against the Naytiba, powerful enemies that stand in Eve and Company's way. Explore and unravel the mysteries and ultimate downfall of Earth with fast-paced combat, upgrades to attain, and more. Stellar Blade is available now for PC (Steam) alongside PlayStation 5 (PS5).

#StellarBlade #Gaming #IGN
title: Stellar Blade - Official PC Launch Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Watch Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Xbox gameplay trailer for this upcoming remake of the 2004 survival stealth action-adventure game, Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater. The new Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater trailer shows gameplay and extra content coming to the Xbox Series X/S version, which features the Snake vs Bomberman special side mode. Take control of Snake and face off with Bomberman in this mode, and blast 'em away in each stage.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater will be available on (PS5) PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC (Steam) on August 28, 2025.

#MetalGearSolidDeltaSnakeEater #Gaming #IGN

author: IGN
description:
Have you ever thought about playing the Pokémon Trading Card game but don’t know where to start? The Pokémon League is the perfect place to start your Pokémon TCG journey, and is where you can meet a friendly community of Pokémon fans who will help you to play. We visited The Games Shop and played in their local Pokémon League tournament to show you how easy it is to take part. Sponsored by The Pokémon Company International. 

Learn more and find your local Pokémon League at pokemon.com/play
Special thanks to The Games Shop https://thegamesshopaldershot.co.uk

#PokemonTGC #PokemonLeague #Gaming

#IGN #Gaming
title: Humblets: Official Reveal Trailer

author: IGN
description:
In this snippet from Podcast Beyond Episode 901, Resident Evil Requiem (or Resident Evil 9, RE9uiem, or whatever we’re supposed to call it) got an official reveal during Summer Game Fest 2025, and shortly after that, a select few people got to play a demo behind closed doors. IGN’s Matt Kim was one of those lucky people, so he stopped by to tell us about the game’s newest features. There’s option to swap between first and third person perspective, but that’s not the only new POV. Grace Ashcroft is a new protagonist, and despite rumors that Leon Kennedy would make his return, there’s no sign of him quite yet, but that could always change. We also discuss the demo’s hospital like setting, a big creepy new monster that’s chasing Grace around, and a few other details.
***
For thousands of years (or at least since the 90s) PlayStation has been pushing the boundaries of the video game medium. For almost as long, Beyond has been along for the ride. Join a panel of passionate playstation expe
title: Resident Evil Evil's New Protagonist is No Action Hero - Beyond Clips

author: IGN
description: Check out the latest DC Worlds Collide trailer for the upcoming free-to-play squad-based RPG set in the DC universe. The new DC Worlds Collide trailer shows the 12 different game modes you can expect, featuring boss battles with increasing difficulty, 5v5 player vs. player arenas, and more. DC Worlds Collide will be available on mobile, and pre-registration is available now.
title: DC Worlds Collide - Official Game Overview Trailer

author: IGN
description:
The Alters reviewed by Dan Stapleton on PC. Also available on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S.

The Alters is a highly atmospheric sci-fi character study of one man who meets the effects of the formative choices he’s made throughout his life face to face. Managing Jan’s relationships with his alternate selves while extracting enough resources from a hostile alien environment to survive is a balancing act on top of a balancing act, and it cleverly builds up the pressure over the course of its story. Exploration of these barren but eye-catching maps presents a series of puzzles and threats without resorting to blasting aliens, and the conversations and moral dilemmas that arise from Jan’s clones are a novel way to approach a game like this. It’s clearly not a big-budget game with resources to throw at cinematics and character models, but it does a lot with a little to tell its story effectively, and its occasional interface quirks don’t get in the way of that.
title: The Alters Review

author: IGN
description:
Long before Resident Evil: Requiem, survivors in Raccoon City were trying to escape in Resident Evil Outbreak, a game that could hold a secret to where the ninth Resident Evil game is going.

So, who is Alyssa Ashcroft, and how is her daughter, FBI Analyst Grace Ashcroft, connected to a now destroyed Umbrella Corporation and Raccoon City? Will Leon Scott Kennedy appear in RE9, especially if we're returning to the RPD? Let's delve into this upcoming world of survival horror.

#IGN #RE9 #ResidentEvil
title: The Forgotten Resident Evil Game That Holds the Secret to Resident Evil: Requiem

author: IGN
description:
Deltarune reviewed by Brendan Graeber on PC and Switch, also available on PlayStation.

Toby Fox and his team have really accomplished something incredible with Deltarune and its new chapters, even if that accomplishment isn’t quite finished just yet. The fact that what appears to be a halfway point in the story can leave off on such a phenomenal and high-stakes note after roughly 20 hours still has me reeling knowing I’ve yet to see the true depths of where this adventure will lead. Though I have my own share of theories, I’m highly confident that no matter what Deltarune’s true ending holds in store, its incredible and well-refined culmination of captivating characters, hilarious and earnest writing, and stellar music has already left one hell of a lasting impact I am not likely to forget.
title: Deltarune Review

author: IGN
description:
Mario Kart World reviewed by Logan Plant on Nintendo Switch 2.
The Nintendo Switch 2 is officially off to the races, and Mario Kart World is a great way to get things started. The first brand-new Mario Kart in a decade makes huge changes to the established formula, but ironically, the best parts about it closely follow the blueprint of every entry that’s come before: unbeatable local multiplayer racing on well-designed tracks that more than live up to the series’ legacy. World’s tight controls, celebratory soundtrack, and universal polish marvelously complement the action, and I can’t wait to see how top players will take full advantage of its exciting parkour mechanics in the months and years ahead. The way Nintendo built 30 courses into an interconnected series of highways is undeniably impressive, too, but Mario Kart’s first attempt at an open world is also fairly uneven across its variety of modes. The clear standout among the new ways to play is Knockout Tour, a thrilling battle
title: Mario Kart World Review

author: IGN
description:
After more than 10 years of Mario Kart 8 dominating the market, Mario Kart World is here to shake up the series in a big way. As the name implies, Mario Kart World is set in an open world, which means there are a ton of changes that Mario Kart veterans need to be aware of. In honor of Mario Kart 8 finishing its final lap, we’ve collected the eight biggest differences in this video.

0:00 - Intro
0:31 - 24 Karts and Counting 
1:09 - New Items Galore
1:51 - Wacky Wipeouts
2:14 - …And Wild Weather
2:47 - The Three P’s
3:59 - Serious Stickers & Cool Costumes
4:52 - Jump, Grind, & Ride
5:40 - Tons of Traffic
title: Mario Kart World: 8 Biggest Differences from Mario Kart 8

author: IGN
description:
IGN's Ryan McCaffrey got to play Gears of War Reloaded on a PS5 Pro – and it was awesome. The Coalition is fully embracing the PS5 Pro's as well as the DualSense's capabilities. Plus: first impressions of playing it on the ROG Ally X handheld! 

IGN's Summer of Gaming is presented by FX’s Alien: Earth. Premieres August 12th on FX and Hulu.

title: I Played Gears of War Reloaded on a PS5 Pro – and it Was Awesome
